channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: China bans hidden car door handles, which can trap people after crashes
item.description: China has introduced new regulations, starting in 2027, requiring all car doors to open manually from both sides. Electric door handles can malfunction in a crash or battery failure.
item.content:encoded:
China has introduced new regulations, starting in 2027, requiring all car doors to open manually from both sides. Electric door handles can malfunction in a crash or battery failure.

(Image credit: Pedro Pardo)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Disney names Josh D'Amaro as its new CEO
item.description: D'Amaro will take over next month from Bob Iger, who has led the company for nearly two decades.
item.content:encoded:
D'Amaro will take over next month from Bob Iger, who has led the company for nearly two decades.

(Image credit: Ricardo Moreira/Getty Images for Disney
)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Syria, once home to a large Jewish community, takes steps to return property to Jews
item.description: A Jewish heritage foundation has set out to help restore private property appropriated after Syrian Jews left the country.
item.content:encoded:
A Jewish heritage foundation has set out to help restore private property appropriated after Syrian Jews left the country.

(Image credit: Jane Arraf)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: NASA delays the launch of Artemis II lunar mission by at least a month
item.description: NASA is targeting March for the launch of four astronauts on a ten-day mission to circle the moon and return safely to Earth, traveling farther than any humans have ventured in deep space.
item.content:encoded:
NASA is targeting March for the launch of four astronauts on a ten-day mission to circle the moon and return safely to Earth, traveling farther than any humans have ventured in deep space.

(Image credit: Miguel J. Rodriguez Carrillo)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: The U.K. investigates its ex-ambassador to the U.S. over alleged leaks to Epstein
item.description: The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
The U.K. government says newly released files related to Jeffrey Epstein suggest that the former British ambassador to the U.S. may have shared market-sensitive information with Epstein.

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What we know about Savannah Guthrie's missing mother
item.description: Nancy Guthrie is 84 and has mobility issues, but she is mentally sharp, Pima County Sheriff Chris Nanos said. She was last seen Saturday evening at her home near Tucson, Ariz.
item.content:encoded:
Today show co-host Savannah Guthrie, went missing on Sunday. While Nancy Guthrie has mobility issues, Sheriff Chris Nanos said that she "is of great sound mind. This is not a dementia-related" case.'/>

Nancy Guthrie is 84 and has mobility issues, but she is mentally sharp, Pima County Sheriff Chris Nanos said. She was last seen Saturday evening at her home near Tucson, Ariz.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Back seats aren't as safe as they should be. A crash test is trying to help
item.description: Better engineering has made the front seat much safer in head-on collisions. But the back seat hasn't kept pace. It's a problem one vehicle safety group is trying to solve.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

Better engineering has made the front seat much safer in head-on collisions. But the back seat hasn't kept pace. It's a problem one vehicle safety group is trying to solve.

(Image credit: Carlos Bernate for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: House votes to end partial government shutdown, setting up contentious talks on ICE
item.description: The House has approved a spending bill to end a short-lived partial government shutdown. Now lawmakers will begin contentious negotiations over new guardrails for immigration enforcement.
item.content:encoded:
The House has approved a spending bill to end a short-lived partial government shutdown. Now lawmakers will begin contentious negotiations over new guardrails for immigration enforcement.

(Image credit: Aaron Schwartz)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Despite a 'ruptured' knee ligament, Lindsey Vonn says she will compete in the Olympics
item.description: The 41-year-old's remarkable comeback from retirement was thrown into jeopardy after she hurt her knee during a crash in competition last week. But that won't keep her from racing in the Olympics.
item.content:encoded:
The 41-year-old's remarkable comeback from retirement was thrown into jeopardy after she hurt her knee during a crash in competition last week. But that won't keep her from racing in the Olympics.

(Image credit: Hans Bezard)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: PepsiCo will cut prices on Lay's, Cheetos by as much as 15%
item.description: The food giant is among many big brands worried as shoppers pull back on snack budgets after years of stubborn inflation.
item.content:encoded:
The food giant is among many big brands worried as shoppers pull back on snack budgets after years of stubborn inflation.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh
